text: Hidegkuti Nándor Stadion was a stadium in Budapest, Hungary. The stadium was opened on 1947 and it served as the home for the MTK Budapest FC until 2014. In 2015 the stadium was demolished, and a completely new arena was built between 2015–16, named Hidegkuti Nándor Stadion. ==History== ===Construction=== During the World War II the original MTK stadium was damaged, therefore a new stadium had to be built. Between 1945 and 1947 MTK played their home matches at their rivals' stadiums, namely Ferencváros and Újpest. In 1953 a concrete edge was built around the running tracks. ===Demolition=== On 6 November 2014, the demolishion of the stadium started. First the floodlights system was uninstalled and then the seats were removed. In May 2015 the demolition of the main stand started. ==Milestone matches== ==Other uses== ===Concerts=== Metallica playing at the MTK stadium in 1988 The American thrash metal band Metallica began their Damaged Justice tour at the stadium on September 11, 1988. ===Film location=== The stadium was used in the 1981 football film Escape to Victory, about Allied prisoners of war interned in a German prison camp during World War II who play an exhibition match against a German team. ==Photo gallery== File:MTK-pálya bontás előtt I 2014. augusztus 31.jpg|The demolished stadium in 2014 File:MTK-pálya bontás előtt V 2014. augusztus 31.jpg File:Magyar Testgyakorlók Köre labdarúgó stadion - panoramio.jpg ==References== ==External links== *Hidegkuti Nándor Stadium (1947-) at magyarfutball.hu Category:Football venues in Hungary Category:MTK Budapest FC Category:Multi-purpose stadiums in Hungary Category:Sports venues in Budapest
